page.title: 01The Bromley Area.
page.content: "Bromley"is derived from the Anglo- Saxon name BROM LEAGE.One of the Bishops of Rochester granted the market charter which resulted in the early growth of Bromley.In the 19th century, Bromley was a staging post for coaches from London to Hastings. The Borough includes many villages, such as Chislehurst and Bickley,which retain an individual character. The coming of the railway stimulated growth to a large town.Wealthy buisness men found the area amendable and the rail link efficient.Some local industry exists today,but most residents commute to London to work, are involved in service industries or work in locally based commerce.Bromley has good recreational facilities.There are parks and woodlands;it has a theatre and cinema,and concert halls and sporting facilities are close by.
